bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Orders available in strata property claims

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In resolving a strata property claim, the tribunal may make one or more of the following orders:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an order requiring a party to do something;
an order requiring a party to refrain from doing something;
an order requiring a party to pay money.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In resolving a strata property claim described in section 121 (1) (e) to (g), the tribunal may make an order directed at the strata corporation, the council or a person who holds 50% or more of the votes, if the order is necessary to prevent or remedy a significantly unfair action, decision or exercise of voting rights.
Despite subsections (1) and (2), the tribunal may not make the following orders:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an order requiring the sale or other disposition of a strata lot;
an order in a class of orders prescribed by regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — appeal of certain strata property claims

bcl:text.#text: Despite the repeal of section 56.5  of this Act, that section, as it read immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in respect of a strata property claim with an initiating notice given before January 1, 2019.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Meaning of words and expressions in Division — cooperative association claims

bcl:text.#text: In this Division, words and expressions have the same meaning as in the  or a regulation under that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Claims within jurisdiction of tribunal for cooperative association claims

bcl:text.#text: Except as otherwise provided in section 113  or in this Division, the tribunal has jurisdiction in a dispute over a claim, in respect of the , in relation to a housing cooperative or a community service cooperative, concerning one or more of the following:

the interpretation or application of the  or a regulation, memorandum or rule under that Act, including a request to examine or take extracts from, or to receive a copy of, a record of an association;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an action or threatened action by the association or its directors in relation to a member;
a decision of the association or its directors in relation to a member.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act, the tribunal is to be considered to have specialized expertise in respect of claims within the jurisdiction of the tribunal under this Division.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Claims beyond jurisdiction of tribunal for cooperative association claims

bcl:text.#text: The tribunal does not have jurisdiction under this Division in relation to a claim that may be dealt with, by the Supreme Court, under any of the following provisions of the :

bcl:text.#text: a claim to which Part 5  or 5.1  of the  applies or Part 6  or 6.1  of the  applies;

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Orders available in cooperative association claims

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In resolving a cooperative association claim, the tribunal may make one or more of the following orders:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an order requiring a party to do something, including requiring the association to provide access to, or a copy of, a record of the association;
an order requiring a party to refrain from doing something;
an order requiring a party to pay money.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In resolving a cooperative association claim brought to the tribunal under section 125 (1) (b) or (c), the tribunal may make an order directed at the association or its directors, if the order is necessary to prevent or remedy an unfairly prejudicial action or decision.
Despite subsections (1) and (2), the tribunal may not make the following orders:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an order requiring the sale or other disposition of real property;
an order in a class of orders prescribed by regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Meaning of words and expressions in Division — society claims

bcl:text.#text: In this Division, words and expressions have the same meaning as in the  or a regulation under that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Claims within jurisdiction of tribunal for society claims

bcl:text.#text: Except as otherwise provided in section 113  or in this Division, the tribunal has jurisdiction in a dispute over a claim, in respect of the , concerning one or more of the following:
the interpretation or application of the  or a regulation, constitution or bylaw under that Act, including a request to inspect, or to receive a copy of, a record of a society;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an action or threatened action by the society or its directors in relation to a member;
a decision of the society or its directors in relation to a member.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act, the tribunal is to be considered to have specialized expertise in respect of claims within the jurisdiction of the tribunal under this Division.

an order requiring a party to refrain from doing something;
an order requiring a party to pay money.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), the tribunal may not make the following orders:

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Division — accident claims
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:text.#text: except in respect of the benefits referred to in section 133 (1) (a) or a determination of responsibility referred to in section 133 (1) (d), has the same meaning as in section 101  of the ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of the benefits referred to in section 133 (1) (a) of this Act, has the same meaning as in

bcl:text.#text: section 1.1  of the  for benefits payable under Part 1 of that Act, and
section 113  of the  for benefits payable under Part 10 of that Act, and
in respect of a determination of responsibility referred to in section 133 (1) (d) of this Act, has the same meaning as in section 1.1 of the ;
has the same meaning as in section 1 of the ;
means the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia continued by the ;
has the same meaning as in section 1 of the ;
has the same meaning as in section 101 of the ;
means the amount prescribed by regulation as the maximum amount that the tribunal may award in an accident claim in accordance with section 133 (1) (c) of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Claims within jurisdiction of tribunal for accident claims

bcl:text.#text: Except as otherwise provided in section 113  or in this Division, the tribunal has jurisdiction in a dispute, in respect of an accident, over a claim concerning one or more of the following:
the determination by an insurer of entitlement to benefits paid or payable under the ;
the determination of whether an injury is a minor injury for the purposes of the ;

liability and damages, if the amount, including loss or damage to property related to the accident but excluding interest and any expenses referred to under section 49 , is less than or equal to the tribunal limit amount;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the determination by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia or a prescribed insurer of the extent to which the initiating party is responsible for the accident.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act, the tribunal

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has exclusive jurisdiction in respect of claims described in subsection (1) (a) or (b) of this section, and
is to be considered to have specialized expertise in respect of claims described in subsection (1) (c) or (d) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For certainty, a person may make a request for tribunal resolution in more than one tribunal proceeding relating to an accident.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Claims beyond jurisdiction of tribunal for accident claims

bcl:text.#text: The tribunal does not have jurisdiction in relation to a claim that may be dealt with, by a court, under any of the following provisions of the :
section 18 (2) ;
section 42.1 ;
section 68 ;
section 77 (2), (8) and (9) ;
section 78 ;
section 79 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The tribunal does not have jurisdiction in relation to the following:

bcl:text.#text: a claim relating to liability and damages claimed under the  in respect of a death;
a claim to which the  applies;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a claim under this Division in respect of an accident that occurred before April 1, 2019.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Matters relating to tribunal limit amount

bcl:text.#text: It is presumed that the amount, including loss or damage to property related to the accident but excluding interest and any expenses referred to in section 49 , that will be awarded for a minor injury in an accident claim described in section 133 (1) (c) is less than or equal to the tribunal limit amount unless a party establishes on the basis of satisfactory evidence that there is a substantial likelihood that the damages will exceed the tribunal limit amount.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a case manager, during case management, or the tribunal, during a tribunal proceeding, determines that the damages in an accident claim described in section 133 (1) (c) would likely exceed the tribunal limit amount,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to the rules, the case manager or the tribunal may, on request of all parties to a dispute, provide to the parties a non-binding neutral evaluation of the likely amount of damages, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the parties may not disclose the evaluation

bcl:clause.bcl:text: if the evaluation is provided by the case manager, to the tribunal, and

bcl:text.#text: the parties may request a dismissal order in accordance with section 22 , or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a party may request that the claim be continued in the Supreme Court.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For certainty, subsections (1) and (2) do not limit the tribunal's authority to refuse to resolve a claim that is not within the tribunal's jurisdiction.

bcl:text.#text: If a party brings or continues any proceeding in the Supreme Court in respect of liability and damages in relation to an accident and the settlement or award is less than the tribunal limit amount, the costs, including disbursements, that may be ordered are limited to an amount that would have been permitted in the tribunal proceeding by order of payment of expenses under section 49 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — claims in relation to accidents

bcl:text.#text: Section 134 (2) (c) does not limit the tribunal's jurisdiction in relation to the  in respect of a claim that involves an accident that occurred before April 1, 2019.

If, before the coming into force of this section, the tribunal had jurisdiction in respect of a claim described in subsection (1), the claim is to continue before the tribunal as a tribunal small claim under Division 3  of this Part.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Meaning of words and expressions in Division — intimate image protection claims

bcl:text.#text: In this Division, words and expressions have the same meaning as in the  and the regulations under that Act, with the exception that "claim" means an application, rather than a claim, as used in that Act and the regulations under that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Claims within jurisdiction of tribunal for intimate image protection claims

in:desc: [application for expedited intimate image protection order]
bcl:text.#text: Except as otherwise provided in section 113  or in this Division, the tribunal has jurisdiction over a claim that is an application made under section 5  of the , including all related matters.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act, the tribunal is to be considered to have specialized expertise in respect of claims within the jurisdiction of the tribunal under this Division.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Orders available in intimate image protection claims

bcl:text.#text: In resolving an intimate image protection claim, including all related matters, and whether or not the tribunal has made or cancelled other orders relating to the same intimate image, the tribunal may make or cancel one or more of the orders referred to in section 5 of the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disapplication and modification of certain provisions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following provisions of this Act do not apply respecting a claim under this Division:

bcl:text.in:desc: [encouragement of resolution by agreement between parties]
bcl:text.#text: section 2 (3) (a) ;
section 7 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [publication of tribunal orders and other information]
bcl:text.#text: section 85 (1) (d) .

bcl:text.in:desc: [application for expedited intimate image protection order]
bcl:text.#text: For the purposes of a claim that is an application made under section 5  of the , including all related matters,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 17 (1) is to be read as requiring case management, at the discretion of the tribunal, subject to this Act and the rules, and
section 17 (2) does not apply.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Commencement
bcl:section.bcl:text: This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.
